item.title: Insert into select (IIS) in collections with names that require escaping are failing
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Investigating Summary: The company is currently investigating an issue. [Low] - Identified Summary: The company has identified the reasons for the issues and is working on a fix. [Low] - Monitoring Summary: The company applied a fix and is continuing to monitor for further issues. [Low] - Update Summary: The company is continuing to monitor for any further issues. [Low] - Resolved Summary: The incident has been resolved, and all regions have been updated and monitored.

Feb 1, 14:20 PST
Resolved - The incident is resolved all region have been updated and we monitored the issue

Feb 1, 12:59 PST
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Feb 1, 12:52 PST
Monitoring - We applied a fix across our clusters and we think the issue has been resolved around 19:37UTC on 2024/02/01.

Feb 1, 09:47 PST
Identified - We have identified the reasons of the issues and we are working on a fix right now.

Feb 1, 07:15 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating the issue the reason why this is failing.

item.title: Increased ingest error rate in use1a1 due to scaling issues.
item.content:encoded:
Jan 4, 11:00 PST
Resolved - After applying a configuration change related to scaling, our API server started to return 500 errors for ingest for a subset of the customers and had an increase of ingest latency for all customers starting from 2024-01-04 19:10:30 UTC. The change was reverted and the errors ended at 2024-01-04 19:31:30 UTC.

item.title: api authentication service outage
item.content:encoded:
Dec 14, 21:45 PST
Resolved - At 05:45Z one of the servers running one of the api authentication services, and api credential cache, became faulty and taken out of service, which caused a spike in 5xx errors from the API servers using that instance authentication service. The system recovered at 06:15Z when the cache has been automatically restarted on a different server.

item.title: Rockset console intermittently available due to auth provider issues
item.content:encoded:
Oct 30, 14:29 PDT
Resolved - Our authentication provider has resolved the issue and we've confirmed that the Rockset console is accessible.

Oct 30, 13:44 PDT
Investigating - We're looking into an issue with customers being unable to access the Rockset console due to an issue with our auth provider. The issue appears to be resolved, but we'll continue investigating.

item.title: Infrastructure issues in usw2a1 and use1a1
item.content:encoded:
Sep 19, 06:39 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Sep 18, 17:02 PDT
Update - All regions but us-west-2 have recovered.

Sep 18, 12:18 PDT
Monitoring - The infrastructure provider has identified a possible root cause and attempting mitigations.

Sep 18, 12:15 PDT
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Sep 18, 12:12 PDT
Identified - Increasing Virtual Instance size is impacted by underlying outage of infrastructure provider.

item.title: Metadata Service Upgrade
item.content:encoded:
Aug 9, 22:01 PDT
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Aug 9, 21:01 PDT
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jul 14, 10:28 PDT
Scheduled - There will be a planned 1-hour maintenance for an infrastructure upgrade of our metadata services that will impact some of the functionality available in your Rockset org. Queries or data ingestion from all clients and sources will not be impacted.

Date & Time: August 10th at 12 AM ET / August 9th at 9 PM PT

Uninterrupted Rockset Service Operations:
- Queries & Query Lambdas
- In existing console sessions
- From all clients to all virtual instances through existing sessions with API Keys
- Ingest - from all existing data sources

Impacted Rockset service Operations :
- API Keys
- Create, Delete, List, Update
- Aliases
- Create, Delete, List, Update
- Collections
- Create, Delete, List, Update
- Roles
- Create, Delete, List, Update
- Integrations
- Create, Delete, List
- Query Lambdas
- Create, Delete, List, Update
- Workspaces
- Create, Delete, List
- Users
- Create, Delete, List, Update preferences
- Views
- Create, Delete, List, Update
- Virtual Instances
- Create, Delete, List
- Mount Collections, Unmount Collection, List Collection Mounts
- Suspend, Resume
- New Network Security Policy Creation
- Authentication
- New Logins to https://console.rockset.com
- New Sessions with API Keys

Note: Sessions end after 24 hours of inactivity for both console and API Keys - if you need an active session, please make sure you login or use your API Key less than 24 hours before the above time window. QLs not used in the 24-hour period prior to the maintenance window might also experience issues during that time.

This planned maintenance is a one-time required infrastructure upgrade, and most ongoing critical operations in our service will continue working as usual, as listed above. If you'd like further details or have any concerns, please get in touch with us at support@rockset.com.

item.title: Query and metadata operations receiving 5xx errors and ingest delays in usw2a1
item.content:encoded:
Jul 10, 16:40 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jul 10, 15:28 PDT
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jul 10, 13:53 PDT
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jul 10, 13:52 PDT
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jul 10, 13:33 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Intermittent 5xx's being served in Oregon cluster
item.content:encoded:
Jul 6, 15:25 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jul 6, 15:24 PDT
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Jul 6, 14:50 PDT
Monitoring - A fix is now in place and we are monitoring that we are no longer serving 5xx's

Jul 6, 14:29 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: AWS EC2 Instance Availability Issue
item.content:encoded:
Jun 20, 05:18 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jun 19, 23:07 PDT
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jun 19, 23:07 PDT
Investigating - We are currently being affected by an EC2 instance issue as noted by AWS in the eu-central-1 region. We are currently seeing this impact Virtual Instance switches.

item.title: Intermittent request failures
item.content:encoded:
May 11, 15:30 PDT
Resolved - On May 11 between 22:00 and 22:30 UTC and again between 22:58 and 23:04 UTC, we saw an increase in load on Rockset systems that caused some requests to fail for API calls to https://api.usw2a1.rockset.com. This issue has been resolved and we don't expect further impact to users.

item.title: Rockset Console not loading
item.content:encoded:
Mar 9, 14:24 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Mar 9, 13:04 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Increased ingest latency from some customers in the euc1a1 region
item.content:encoded:
Mar 7, 14:19 PST
Resolved - The fix put into place has resolved the issue. We have not seen any reoccurrence for ingest latency since 17:00UTC

Mar 7, 09:14 PST
Monitoring - We have fixed the ingestion latency issue and are now monitoring it

Mar 7, 08:31 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue and a fix is being implemented

Mar 7, 08:05 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Delayed Ingest
item.content:encoded:
Feb 9, 15:30 PST
Resolved - We detected an issue that was inadvertently rate limiting ingestion for all customers. Our team has resolved the issue and confirmed ingestion latency has returned to normal levels.

item.title: AWS instance type shortage
item.content:encoded:
Nov 22, 04:06 PST
Resolved - We have managed to acquire the needed resources in the EU region that was impacted by the AWS instance shortage.

Nov 22, 03:00 PST
Identified - Rockset is currently experiencing difficulties in allocating new machines from AWS. This is likely due to the Black Friday event. Customers are advised to not scale down their Virtual Instances and work with our customer support if they need any Virtual Instances scaled up. We expect the situation to get back to normal early next week.

item.title: Elevated API latency and timeouts
item.content:encoded:
Nov 13, 22:30 PST
Resolved - We saw elevated API request latency and timeout errors in our us-west-2 cluster during the time window between 1:30am and 8:30am PST. This issue is now resolved.

item.title: Small number of customers experiencing query errors in use1a1
item.content:encoded:
Oct 12, 09:00 PDT
Resolved - A small number of customers experienced query errors in use1a1 from 16:10 UTC (9:10 PST) -> 16:45 UTC (9:45 PST).
The changes causing this have been rolled back.

item.title: Query errors in all regions
item.content:encoded:
Aug 16, 16:22 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Aug 16, 15:27 PDT
Identified - The issue has been identified and the fix is rolling out

Aug 16, 15:25 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating the issue

item.title: Query errors in us-west-2 region
item.content:encoded:
Aug 9, 01:50 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Aug 9, 00:54 PDT
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Aug 8, 23:52 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Elevated 403 responses in all rockset regions
item.content:encoded:
Aug 4, 11:00 PDT
Resolved - Starting at 18:20 GMT we saw in increase in 403s happening for requests.
Incident resolved 19:09 at GMT.

item.title: Partial Query Outage
item.content:encoded:
Apr 6, 18:30 PDT
Resolved - On 2022-04-07 between 01:37 - 01:52 UTC users may have seen an elevated number of 5xx responses when querying rockset.

item.title: Virtual Instance switching unavailable and some forms of large ingestions impacted
item.content:encoded:
Mar 31, 19:44 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Mar 31, 19:06 PDT
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Mar 31, 15:40 PDT
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

item.title: Scheduled Infrastructure Upgrade on Internal Systems
item.content:encoded:
Feb 21, 22:00 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 21, 21:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 17, 16:57 PST
Scheduled - We will be undergoing scheduled infrastructure upgrade for our internal systems that won't impact any of our critical operations. The following operations will continue to work as they normally do:
* Queries & Query Lambdas
* In existing console sessions
* From all clients through existing sessions with API Keys
* Ingest - from all existing data sources

Note: Sessions end after 4 hours of inactivity for console and 24 hours for API Keys - if you need an active session please make sure you login within 4 hours or use your API Key less than 24 hours before the above time window.

The following operations will be disabled during the 1 hour upgrade window:
* Collections
* Create, Delete, List
* Aliases
* Create, Delete, List, Update
* Workspaces
* Create, Delete, List
* Views
* Create, Delete, List, Update
* Query Lambdas
* Create, Delete, List, Update
* Integrations
* Create, Delete, List
* Users
* Create, Delete, List, Update preferences
* Roles
* Create, Delete, List, Update
* API Keys
* Create, Delete, List, Update
* New Network Security Policy Creation
* Virtual Instances
* List, Update
* Authentication
* New Logins to console.rockset.com (http://console.rockset.com/)
* New Sessions with API Keys

If you experiencing any issues or have any concerns please reach out to us at support@rockset.com.

item.title: API Errors
item.content:encoded:
Jan 5, 23:20 PST
Resolved - This issue is now resolved.

Jan 5, 22:20 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue and are working on remediation.

Jan 5, 21:32 PST
Investigating - We are noticing elevated API errors and investigating the issue.

item.title: Delays in VI switching in us-east-1 cluster
item.content:encoded:
Dec 8, 06:14 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 7, 15:05 PST
Monitoring - The us-east-1 cluster is now fully operational as the underlying AWS issue seems resolved. We'll continue to monitor the status of the cluster.

Dec 7, 10:09 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and is currently being investigated by AWS https://status.aws.amazon.com/

item.title: AWS issue in us-west-2
item.content:encoded:
Aug 31, 16:21 PDT
Resolved - The AWS incident is closed and everything is back to normal operations.

Aug 31, 14:51 PDT
Update - Auth0 has resolved their issue and authentication is back to normal.

We are still waiting for the AWS resolution to the us-west-2a connectivity issue.

Aug 31, 14:29 PDT
Update - The AWS outage is still in progress. We're continuing to monitor the progress.

Aug 31, 13:05 PDT
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented for the ingestion issues and we are monitoring the results.

Aug 31, 12:23 PDT
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Aug 31, 12:23 PDT
Update - We identified one of the availability zones in us-west-2 has problems with outbound internet connections, so we have rerouted traffic through another availability zone, which have resolved the ingestion errors we previously had.

There are still Auth0 authentication issues, as they experiencing similar issues.

We will continue to monitor the status of the services.

Aug 31, 12:07 PDT
Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue and the impact it has for our customers.

Aug 31, 11:29 PDT
Investigating - AWS is having reliability issues in us-west-2, and we're investigating the impact on our services:

From the AWS status page:
We are investigating an issue which is affecting network traffic for some customers using AWS services in the US-WEST-2 Region.
